body_html:
OK, thanks again for the feedback.
Instead, how about to add VLOG Level to the tail or the head of messages?
I only want to recognize what VLOG level it is, and it is boring to check VLOG level by using TF_CPP_MIN_VLOG_LEVEL repeatedly.

Example 1:

2017-12-27 21:26:43.712063: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/executor.cc:1557] Debug (VLOG:2)

Example 2:

2017-12-27 21:26:43.712063: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/executor.cc:1557] (VLOG:2) Debug

OK, thanks again for the feedback.
Instead, how about to add VLOG Level to the tail or the head of messages?
I only want to recognize what VLOG level it is, and it is boring to check VLOG level by using TF_CPP_MIN_VLOG_LEVEL repeatedly.

2017-12-27 21:26:43.712063: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/executor.cc:1557] (VLOG:2) Debug
body:
OK, thanks again for the feedback.
Instead, how about to add VLOG Level to the tail or the head of messages?
I only want to recognize what VLOG level it is, and it is boring to check VLOG level by using ```TF_CPP_MIN_VLOG_LEVEL``` repeatedly.

Example 1:

```
2017-12-27 21:26:43.712063: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/executor.cc:1557] Debug (VLOG:2)
```

Example 2:

```
2017-12-27 21:26:43.712063: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/executor.cc:1557] (VLOG:2) Debug
```
